text.text_translated: The Life of Pi tells an amazing story about a teenage boy from India. His name is Pi. His ship sinks in the Pacific Ocean. He is stuck on a small boat with a very dangerous tiger. The Canadian writer Yann Martel wrote the book. It is his third book. The book came out in 2001. It sold more than seven million copies all over the world. It also won many prizes. People can read it in 41 different languages. Martel's father was a diplomat. A diplomat is a person with an important job. They work for their country in other countries. When Martel was a child, he lived in Costa Rica, Canada, France and Mexico.
